segments.text: My eyes are drawn to the other side of the kitchen, near the cupboards.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There's a boy, quite young, balanced precariously on a two-step stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks incredibly unstable, almost ready to tip over at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's reaching high into an open cabinet, his hand deep inside a cookie jar labeled "COOKIE JAR."
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: A girl stands beside him, her hand outstretched, clearly waiting for her share of the loot.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're working together, a silent, mischievous conspiracy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm amazed at the daring of these children, completely focused on their mission.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a clever plan, especially with the adult so distracted.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But that stool is just so wobbly; I can almost see it wobbling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're going to fall, or at least make a huge clatter, and then they'll be caught.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of all those cookies tumbling to the floor is a little bit sad.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They really should be more careful, but I understand the allure of fresh cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR
